size.large.borderWidth.s: The smallest border size. Used for gridlines.
size.large.borderWidth.m: The default border size. Used for axes borders, default data lines.
size.large.borderWidth.l: A larger border size. Used for borders between filled elements.
size.large.borderWidth.xl: A larger border size. Used for lines in focus, and the bottom chart container line.
size.large.borderWidth.xxl: The largest border size. Used for the top chart container line.
size.small.borderWidth.s: The smallest border size. Used for gridlines.
size.small.borderWidth.m: The default border size. Used for axes borders, default data lines.
size.small.borderWidth.l: A larger border size. Used for borders between filled elements.
size.small.borderWidth.xl: A larger border size. Used for lines in focus, and the bottom chart container line.
size.small.borderWidth.xxl: The largest border size. Used for the top chart container line.
size.borderWidth.s: The smallest border size. Used for gridlines.
size.borderWidth.m: The default border size. Used for axes borders, default data lines.
size.borderWidth.l: A larger border size. Used for borders between filled elements.
size.borderWidth.xl: A larger border size. Used for lines in focus, and the bottom chart container line.
size.borderWidth.xxl: The largest border size. Used for the top chart container line.
color.dark.text.stronger: Stronger text color for maximum background contrast.
color.dark.complementary.base: Second step in the base diverging color scale, used for values lower than zero (or data median).
color.dark.complementary.weaker: Second step in the base diverging color scale, used for values lower than zero (or data median).
color.dark.complementary.stronger: First step in the based diverging color scale, used for the lowest (most negative) value.
color.light.background.base: The default light background color, used e.g. as a backdrop for charts or cards.
color.light.background.weaker: A slightly shaded background color, used e.g. as a backdrop behind card elements.
color.light.background.weakest: A shaded background color, used e.g. as a backdrop in containers.
color.light.foreground.base: Used for elements in the foreground that have a strong contrast to the background.
color.light.foreground.weak: Used for elements in the foreground that have a weaker contrast to the background (e.g. axes).
color.light.foreground.weaker: Used for elements in the foreground that have the weakest contrast to the background (e.g. ticks, help-lines)
color.light.theme.base: Main theme color, usually the brand color.
color.light.functional.accent: Used for author-driven accents of parts of charts, texts and other elements.
color.light.functional.filteredOut: Used for visual marks in charts that have been filtered out.
color.light.functional.focus: Used for author-driven accents of parts of charts, texts and other elements.
color.light.functional.notAvailable: Used for visual marks (e.g. countries in maps) where data is missing from the dataset.
color.light.diverging.negative.1: Second step in the base diverging color scale, used for values lower than zero (or data median).
color.light.diverging.negative.2: First step in the based diverging color scale, used for the lowest (most negative) value.
color.light.diverging.neutral: Third step in the base diverging color scale, used for zero or data median.
color.light.diverging.positive.1: Fourth step in the base diverging color scale, used for values higher than zero (or data median).
color.light.diverging.positive.2: Fifth step in the base diverging color scale, used for the highest (most positive) value.
color.light.sequential.positive.0: First step in the base (theme) sequential color scale, used for the lowest value.
color.light.sequential.positive.1: Second step in the base (theme) sequential color scale.
color.light.sequential.positive.2: Thirs step in the base (theme) sequential color scale.
color.light.sequential.positive.3: Third and final step in the base (theme) sequential color scale.
typography.style.huge: Used for summary statistics, large numbers, etc.
typography.style.large: Used for the title of a chart.
typography.style.majorPrimary: Used for legend main labels, as well as individual value annotations.
typography.style.majorSecondary: Used for secondary legend labels, description, and the chart subtitle.
typography.style.minorPrimary: Used for smaller annotations in charts.
typography.style.minorSecondary: Used for tick labels, secondary annotations, footer text.
